intro: Reseda tripartita, commonly known as three-parted reseda, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, white or pink, and arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Reseda tripartita is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
